subject: Re: [junit] How do I implement a test case for a thrown exception ?
msgSnippet: ... So maybe it woud suffice to change JUnit s output in case of an unexpected exception, i.e. an error. Therewith the pattern would be simpler with less code.
messageBody:
Mike Duffy wrote:
>
> I agree with the point that listing all the possible exceptions
> greatly increases code maintenance. The goal was to know what
> exception was thrown if the specific exception being tested is not
> thrown (without having to go to a stack trace).

So maybe it woud suffice to change JUnit's output in case of an
unexpected exception, i.e. an error. Therewith the pattern would be
simpler with less code.

Johannes
